item.title: This is why you should consider using model-based clustering
item.description: Let’s suppose you have the following data. It contains 177 wines with some characteristics about them. You’d like to group them in such way you can create a marketing campaign, for example. set.seed(143) pkgs <- c("mclust", "dplyr") invisible(lapply(pkgs, require, character.only = TRUE)) df <- read.csv('https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/machine-learning-databases/wine/wine.data') names(df) <- c('Type', 'Alcohol', 'Malic_acid', 'Ash', 'Alcalinity', 'Magnesium', 'Total_phenols', 'Flavanoids', 'Nonflavanoid_phenols', 'Proanthocyanins', 'Color_intensity', 'Hue', 'OD280', 'Proline') df <- df %>% select(-Type) glimpse(df) ## Observations: 177 ## Variables: 13 ## $ Alcohol <dbl> 13.
